sentences: Zeena Parkins (born 1956) is an American composer and multi-instrumentalist active in experimental, free improvised, contemporary classical, and avant-jazz music; she is known for having "reinvented the harp".
She is a 2019 Guggenheim Fellow and professor in the Music Department at Mills College.
Born in 1956 in Detroit, Michigan, Parkins studied at Bard College and moved to New York City in 1984.
Parkins received a 1997 Foundation for Contemporary Arts Grants to Artists Award.
